item.title: Cant see Donator Private Messages Read
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“haviland4, post:23, topic:541578”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=660449.msg4416169#msg4416169 date=1396030154]

Yes…

so this one? http://pastebin.com/fgA8n3mq

Correct…
[/quote]
ok so what should i be changing?[/quote]

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/tutorials/348186-renamed-adding-custom-crowns-detailed-all-chat-types-rewritten-conventi.html
Like I said earlier, use this tutorial to find what methods you need to look in. You want to specifically look at the ones for private chat. Make sure it supports the image and rights.

item.title: Cant see Donator Private Messages Read
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:13, topic:541578”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=660449.msg4416026#msg4416026 date=1395962733]

Do any of you read my posts?

I do.
However, why set the playerRights to 0 (making it so the donator would have no crown) instead of setting it to 4, and editing the client to handle it properly?
[/quote]Player rights denote membership, not donator, so the correct way would be to have a donator flag instead of using p rights in such a way. The client also has a members flag (for item def etc)…

How do player rights == membership? The membership flag is supposed to be for if the player is a member or not… I mean, you could honestly use that flag for the donator rank (you’d probably have to edit some things in itemdef, as you pointed out).

I thought the whole point of player rights was to establish whom was staff or not. People just took that, and added extra “crowns” (Just icons, really) into the cache for people that donated, and applied rights.

But yes, you are right. Donator rank != player rights and they should be handled differently. Though, I’m giving him a solution for how he currently handles it (and generally everyone else).[/quote]Uh I mistyped that, I meant that it doesn’t denote membership.

Read full topic
item.source: Cant see Donator Private Messages Read

item.title: Cant see Donator Private Messages Read
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:12, topic:541578”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=660449.msg4416024#msg4416024 date=1395962025]

Do any of you read my posts?

I do.
However, why set the playerRights to 0 (making it so the donator would have no crown) instead of setting it to 4, and editing the client to handle it properly?
[/quote]Player rights denote membership, not donator, so the correct way would be to have a donator flag instead of using p rights in such a way. The client also has a members flag (for item def etc)…[/quote]
How do player rights == membership? The membership flag is supposed to be for if the player is a member or not… I mean, you could honestly use that flag for the donator rank (you’d probably have to edit some things in itemdef, as you pointed out).

I thought the whole point of player rights was to establish whom was staff or not. People just took that, and added extra “crowns” (Just icons, really) into the cache for people that donated, and applied rights.

But yes, you are right. Donator rank != player rights and they should be handled differently. Though, I’m giving him a solution for how he currently handles it (and generally everyone else).

Read full topic
item.source: Cant see Donator Private Messages Read

I do.
However, why set the playerRights to 0 (making it so the donator would have no crown) instead of setting it to 4, and editing the client to handle it properly?[/quote]Player rights denote membership, not donator, so the correct way would be to have a donator flag instead of using p rights in such a way. item.title: Cant see Donator Private Messages Read
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“DAn0194, post:7, topic:541578”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=660449.msg4416011#msg4416011 date=1395960019]
Guys. It’s client sided…
This tutorial should help
[/quote]
May be wrong but I think he’s saying that you can’t see the name at all.[/quote]
Yes. I understand.
But the tutorial itself shows you what parts of the client you need to edit to allow extra sprites (like donator images) to chat types (Public chat, private chat, split private chat, etc).
Here’s a drawSplitPrivateChat method (for example):

[code=java]
private void drawSplitPrivateChat()
{
if(splitPrivateChat == 0)
return;
RSFont textDrawingArea = aTextDrawingArea_1271;
int i = 0;
if(anInt1104 != 0)
i = 1;
for(int j = 0; j < 100; j++)
if(chatMessages[j] != null)
{

			int k = chatTypes[j];
			String s = chatNames[j];
			byte byte1 = 0;
			/*
			 * This is where the Client assigns a crown to a specific modIcon.
			 * If you remember from previous code we were assigning a modIcon to a byte called byte1.
			 * This is where we relate the two together making @cr#@ call a crown sprite rather then just be text.
			 * @Variable s, This is the player's name, It's telling the client to start the name after the 5th character
			 * 				which would be the last @ sign.
			*/
			if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr1@")) {
				s = s.substring(5);
				byte1 = 1;
			}
			if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr2@")) {
				s = s.substring(5);
				byte1 = 2;
			}
			if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr3@")) {
				s = s.substring(5);
				byte1 = 3;
			}
			if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr4@")) {
				s = s.substring(5);
				byte1 = 4;
			}
			if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr5@")) {
				s = s.substring(5);
				byte1 = 5;
			}
			if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr6@")) {
				s = s.substring(5);
				byte1 = 6;
			}
			if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr7@")) {
				s = s.substring(5);
				byte1 = 7;
			}
			if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr8@")) {
				s = s.substring(5);
				byte1 = 8;
			}
			if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr9@")) {
				s = s.substring(5);
				byte1 = 9;
			}
			if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr10@")) {
				s = s.substring(6);
				byte1 = 10;
			}
			if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr11@")) {
				s = s.substring(6);
				byte1 = 11;
			}
			if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr12@")) {
				s = s.substring(6);
				byte1 = 12;
			}
			if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr13@")) {
				s = s.substring(6);
				byte1 = 13;
			}
			if(s != null && s.startsWith("@cr14@")) {
				s = s.substring(6);
				byte1 = 14;
			}
			if((k == 3 || k == 7) && (k == 7 || privateChatMode == 0 || privateChatMode == 1 && isFriendOrSelf(s)))
			{
				int l = 329 - i * 13;
				int k1 = 4;
				textDrawingArea.method385(0, "From", l, k1);
				textDrawingArea.method385(65535, "From", l - 1, k1);
				k1 += textDrawingArea.getTextWidth("From ");
				/*
				 * This is where the Client assigns a crown to a variable, byte1.
				 * Byte1 is used to call the crown sprite when needed.
				 * @Variable k1, This signifies the "From: " text width.
				*/
				if(byte1 == 1) {
					modIcons[0].drawSprite(k1, l - 12);
					k1 += 12;
				}
				if(byte1 == 2) {
					modIcons[1].drawSprite(k1, l - 12);
					k1 += 12;
				}
				if(byte1 == 3) {
					modIcons[2].drawSprite(k1, l - 12);
					k1 += 12;
				}
				if(byte1 == 4) {
					modIcons[3].drawSprite(k1, l - 12);
					k1 += 12;
				}
				if(byte1 == 5) {
					modIcons[4].drawSprite(k1, l - 12);
					k1 += 12;
				}
				if(byte1 == 6) {
					modIcons[5].drawSprite(k1, l - 12);
					k1 += 12;
				}
				if(byte1 == 7) {
					modIcons[6].drawSprite(k1, l - 12);
					k1 += 12;
				}
				if(byte1 == 8) {
					modIcons[7].drawSprite(k1, l - 12);
					k1 += 12;
				}
				if(byte1 == 9) {
					modIcons[8].drawSprite(k1, l - 12);
					k1 += 12;
				}
				if(byte1 == 10) {
					modIcons[9].drawSprite(k1, l - 12);
					k1 += 12;
				}
				if(byte1 == 11) {
					modIcons[10].drawSprite(k1, l - 12);
					k1 += 12;
				}
				if(byte1 == 12) {
					modIcons[11].drawSprite(k1, l - 12);
					k1 += 12;
				}
				if(byte1 == 13) {
					modIcons[12].drawSprite(k1, l - 12);
					k1 += 12;
				}
				if(byte1 == 14) {
					modIcons[13].drawSprite(k1, l - 12);
					k1 += 12;
				}
				textDrawingArea.method385(0, s + ": " + chatMessages[j], l, k1);
				textDrawingArea.method385(65535, s + ": " + chatMessages[j], l - 1, k1);
				if(++i >= 5)
					return;
			}
			if(k == 5 && privateChatMode < 2)
			{
				int i1 = 329 - i * 13;
				textDrawingArea.method385(0, chatMessages[j], i1, 4);
				textDrawingArea.method385(65535, chatMessages[j], i1 - 1, 4);
				if(++i >= 5)
					return;
			}
			if(k == 6 && privateChatMode < 2)
			{
				int j1 = 329 - i * 13;
				textDrawingArea.method385(0, "To " + s + ": " + chatMessages[j], j1, 4);
				textDrawingArea.method385(65535, "To " + s + ": " + chatMessages[j], j1 - 1, 4);
				if(++i >= 5)
					return;
			}
		}

}[/code]

This is generally how refactored/renamed handles it (it’s kinda nasty, amirite?).
This one, in particular, was modified to handle 14 different ranks (and each rank would give an icon).
The “standard” one only handles 4 ranks: 0, 1, 2, 3. That would mean anything above rank 3 would only show: “From:” and thus, his issue.

Read full topic

[quote=“Ashi, post:2, topic:541578”]if (c.playerRights >= 2 || PlayerHandler.players[i2].privateChat == 0 || (PlayerHandler.players[i2].privateChat == 1 && o.getPA().isInPM(myName))) { o.getPA().sendPM(myName, c.playerRights, pmchatText, pmchatTextSize);

I’m guessing it has something to do with that code. It might be a problem with sendPM() method in PlayerAssistant? I only skimmed your code so I might of missed something related to your problem.[/quote]

item.title: Cant see Donator Private Messages Read
item.dc:creator: @haviland4 haviland4
item.description:
@haviland4 wrote:

Hey everyone i wanted to fix donator private messages bug.

when a donator rights 4 sends a private message to anyone the message only shows From

Deathlypvpz v4.1

I Added PrivateMessaging.java but i have no idea if its this problem thats why i am asking for help :palm:

package server.model.players.packets;


import server.Config;
import server.Server;
import server.Connection;
import server.model.players.Client;
import server.model.players.PacketType;
import server.model.players.PlayerHandler;
import server.util.Misc;

/**
 * Private messaging, friends etc
 **/
public class PrivateMessaging implements PacketType {

	public final int ADD_FRIEND = 188, SEND_PM = 126, REMOVE_FRIEND = 215, CHANGE_PM_STATUS = 95, REMOVE_IGNORE = 59, ADD_IGNORE = 133;
	@Override
	public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) {
		switch(packetType) {
		
			case ADD_FRIEND:
			c.friendUpdate = true;
			long friendToAdd = c.getInStream().readQWord();
			boolean canAdd = true;

			for (int i1 = 0; i1 < c.friends.length; i1++) {
				if (c.friends[i1] != 0 && c.friends[i1] == friendToAdd) {
					canAdd = false;
					c.sendMessage(friendToAdd + " is already on your friends list.");
				}
			}
			if (canAdd == true) {
				for (int i1 = 0; i1 < c.friends.length; i1++) {
					if (c.friends[i1] == 0) {
						c.friends[i1] = friendToAdd;
						for (int i2 = 1; i2 < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i2++) {
							if (Server.playerHandler.players[i2] != null && Server.playerHandler.players[i2].isActive && Misc.playerNameToInt64(Server.playerHandler.players[i2].playerName)== friendToAdd) {
								Client o = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i2];
								if(o != null) {
									if (Server.playerHandler.players[i2].privateChat == 0 || (Server.playerHandler.players[i2].privateChat == 1 && o.getPA().isInPM(Misc.playerNameToInt64(c.playerName)))) {
										c.getPA().loadPM(friendToAdd, 1);
										break;
									}
								}
							}
						}
						break;
					}
				}
			}
			break;
			case SEND_PM:
			long sendMessageToFriendId = c.getInStream().readQWord();
            byte pmchatText[] = new byte[100];
            int pmchatTextSize = (byte) (packetSize - 8);
			c.getInStream().readBytes(pmchatText, pmchatTextSize, 0);
			if(Connection.isMuted(c)) {
				return;
			}
			long myName = Misc.playerNameToInt64(c.playerName);
            for (long element : c.friends) {
                if (element == sendMessageToFriendId) {
                    boolean pmSent = false;

                    for (int i2 = 1; i2 < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i2++) {
                        if (PlayerHandler.players[i2] != null && PlayerHandler.players[i2].isActive && (Misc.playerNameToInt64(PlayerHandler.players[i2].playerName)== sendMessageToFriendId)) {
                            Client o = (Client)PlayerHandler.players[i2];
							if(o != null) {
								if (c.playerRights >= 2 || PlayerHandler.players[i2].privateChat == 0 || (PlayerHandler.players[i2].privateChat == 1 && o.getPA().isInPM(myName))) {
									o.getPA().sendPM(myName, c.playerRights, pmchatText, pmchatTextSize);
	                                pmSent = true;
	                            }
							}
                            break;
                        }
                    }
                    if (!pmSent) {
						c.sendMessage("That player is currently offline.");
						break;
                    }
                }
            }
            break;		
			
			
			case REMOVE_FRIEND:
			c.friendUpdate = true;
            long friendToRemove = c.getInStream().readQWord();

            for (int i1 = 0; i1 < c.friends.length; i1++) {
                if (c.friends[i1] == friendToRemove) {
					for (int i2 = 1; i2 < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i2++) {
						Client o = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i2];		
						if(o != null) {
							if(c.friends[i1] == Misc.playerNameToInt64(Server.playerHandler.players[i2].playerName)){
								o.getPA().updatePM(c.playerId, 0);
								break;
							}
						}
					}
					c.friends[i1] = 0;
                    break;
                }
            }
            break;
			

			
			case CHANGE_PM_STATUS:
            int tradeAndCompete = c.getInStream().readUnsignedByte();
            c.privateChat = c.getInStream().readUnsignedByte();
            int publicChat = c.getInStream().readUnsignedByte();
            for (int i1 = 1; i1 < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i1++) {
			   if (Server.playerHandler.players[i1] != null && Server.playerHandler.players[i1].isActive == true) {
                    Client o = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i1];
					if(o != null) {
						o.getPA().updatePM(c.playerId, 1);
					}
                }
            }
            break;
			
			
			
			case ADD_IGNORE:
				//TODO: fix this so it works :)
				break;
            
		}
		
	}	
}

Read full topic
item.source: Cant see Donator Private Messages Read
